intro: Gossia aphthosa subsp. aphthosa, commonly known as the smooth-leaved gossia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth texture. It is a member of the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees.
